title: Vase, 1906–15
markings: Impressed and reinforced in blue: potter's monogram JM, conjoined / C in a circle / 143 [shape #] / M; incised and reinforced in blue: decorator's monogram CL, conjoined /1 13; painted in blue: HB25.
provenance:
Jordan-Volpe Gallery, New York
Marcia and William Goodman
creditline: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
description: Buff clay body, thrown. Ovoid body with swelling at shoulder, truncated neck - no foot. Carved in relief, recessed ground, design of Spanish moss-covered oak trees encircling body, against background of underbrush and sky; lower quarter of design below tress is undecorated. Waxy mat glazes of blue, green and blue-green; sky is cream mat glaze. Interior is cream mat glaze. Bottom not glazed. Crazing to glaze.

tombstone.epitaph:
Vase, 1906–15.
1906–15. Glazed earthenware. Gift of Marcia and William Goodman. 1984-84-41.
